name: euphonically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal in a way that sounds pleasant: He spoke succinctly, if not euphonically. She creates rhymes that are euphonically rich and pleasing. Synonym
euphoniously
language
  specialized (of a speech sound in some languages) in a way that has been changed to make it easier to pronounce: This sound is euphonically inserted before a vowel. In some dialects, this sound is sometimes used euphonically.
More examplesFewer examplesTheir music euphonically blends jazz and soul.He always tried to speak as clearly, briefly, and euphonically as possible. The p sound is euphonically inserted to strengthen the syllable.
